meanings.sent1: The book was placed interpolated the two bookends on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The cat squeezed itself into the small gap interpolated the two boxes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel hid its acorn stash interpolated the leaves.
meanings.sent4: The secret message was cleverly hidden interpolated the lines of the letter.
meanings.sent5: The rainbow appeared to be painted interpolated the clouds in the sky.

meanings.sent1: The graph showed an interpolated point between the two plotted data points.
meanings.sent2: The weather forecast included an interpolated temperature for the upcoming days.
meanings.sent3: The treasure hunter found an old map with an interpolated location marked.
meanings.sent4: The missing puzzle piece was an interpolated guess based on the surrounding pieces.
meanings.sent5: The map had an interpolated route drawn between the start and end points.

meanings.definition: Alter or falsify (a text) by the insertion of new matter
meanings.sent1: The spy interpolated false information into the enemy's communication.
meanings.sent2: The student tried to interpolated additional paragraphs into the essay at the last minute.
meanings.sent3: The comedian jokingly interpolated made-up words into his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent4: The forger attempted to interpolated a fake signature onto the document.
meanings.sent5: The hacker managed to interpolated a virus into the computer system undetected.
